abstract.t: This document defines a set of IANA registries for supported cryptographic algorithm test specifications in the Automated Cryptographic Validation Protocol (ACVP) . This document also shows how to extend the capabilities of ACVP with testing for new cryptographic algorithms.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The Automated Cryptographic Validation Protocol (ACVP) defines a mechanism to automatically validate the cryptographic algorithm implementations of software or hardware cryptographic modules. The ACVP specification defines how a cryptographic module communicates with a validation authority server, including cryptographic capabilities negotiation, session management, authentication, test vector processing and more. The ACVP specification does not define algorithm-specific JSON constructs for performing the cryptographic validation. A series of ACVP-related sub-specifications define the constructs for testing individual cryptographic algorithms, see for example . Each such sub-specification addresses a specific algorithm or a class of cryptographic algorithms. This document defines the IANA registry for the supported algorithm test specifications that work with ACVP. The registry defined here provides the binding between the protocol and the supported algorithm test extensions.

section.title: IANA namespaces
section.t:
There are three namespaces envisioned for extensions to the ACVP:
ACVP - the approved algorithms for testing with one or more validation authorities EXPERIMENTAL - candidate algorithms for approval. LOCAL - locally supported algorithms, not guaranteed for interoperability. Algorithms in this namespace cannot be registered with IANA.

section.title: Algorithm registry
section.t:
Each entry in the algorithm registry must record the following fields:
Name: a URN segment that conforms to the pattern {namespace}-{algorithm}. The keywords are defined as follows:
{namespace}: one of the options from . {algorithm}: a required US-ASCII string that conforms to the URN syntax requirements (see ). This string must be unique within the corresponding namespace.
Revision: the revision identifier for the test specification of a particular algorithm. A required US-ASCII string that conforms to the URN syntax requirements (see ). Reference: A static link to the specification and section where the definition of the parameter can be found.

section.title: Requirements Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted in RFC 2119.

section.title: Acknowledgements
section.t: Many thanks to David Waltermire for his helpful comments to get us started on the right path.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This memo includes several requests to IANA.

section.title: ACVP URN Sub-namespace
section.t: IANA should add an entry to the "IETF URN Sub-namespace for Registered Protocol Parameter Identifiers" registry located at https://www.iana.org/assignments/params/ as per .

The entry should be as follows:
Registered Parameter Identifier: ACVP Specification: this document Repository: ACVP URN Parameters (see )

section.title: ACVP URN Parameters
section.t: A new top-level registry should be created, titled "Automated Cryptographic Validation Protocol (ACVP) URN Parameters".

Registration in the "ACVP URN Parameters" registry is via the Specification Required policy . Registration requests must be sent to both the ACVP Working Group mailing list (acvp@ietf.org) and IANA. IANA will forward registration requests to the Designated Expert.
Each entry in this subregistry must record the following fields:

list.t: Name: A required US-ASCII string that conforms to the URN syntax requirements (see ). This string MUST be constructed according to the specification in . Note: entries from the namespace "LOCAL" SHALL be forbidden from this table.
Revision: A required US-ASCII string that conforms to the URN syntax requirements (see ). The combination {Name}-{Revision} for each entry MUST be unique for the entire subregistry.
Reference: A static link to the specification and section where the definition of the parameter can be found.

section.t: This repository SHALL have as initial values the entries in .

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: Security considerations are addressed by the ACVP specification.
